result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kirklend K Krause in court.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Kirklend K Krause.  Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Still negotiating, possible resolution. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kirklend K Krause in court.  Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Kirklend K Krause. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Discovery issues, State following up with City of Delavan. Case to be re-assigned, Clerk to contact parties with new date in early August. Minutes filed.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kirklend K Krause in court.  Attorney Tomaszewski for Attorney Keith Kolby Venema in court for Kirklend K Krause. Asking for 30-45 days. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

3:37pm Court in session 

Defendant Kirklend K Krause appeared in court with Attorney Caleb Tomaszewski for attorney Keith Kolby Venema. ADA J.J. Crawford appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. State has information & provides copies to Defense & the Court.

Record by the State that the parties have an agreement to modify the bond conditions.

Court will modify bond as agreed upon by the parties. Court will modify bond to allow supervised contact with B.E. when an adult is present

Nothing further from the parties

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Kirklend K Krause appeared in court with attorney Keith Venema. Motion to modify bond by attorney Venema, denied. Bond remains. Reading of complaint waived. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Attorney Venema states that CPS has closed their case involving defendant. State objects to modifying bond until more information is received from CPS. State is waiting on a call back. Vicitms mother present in court and makes statement. Rights given and hearing requested, time period waived. Minutes filed.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.
see signature bond for conditions

AMENDMENT 3/4/2022: Court will allow supervised contact with B.E. when an adult is present

DEFENDANT TO POST $2,000 CASH
Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH B.E.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-451

Defendant Kirklend Krause appeared in court, in custody by video with attorney Mackenzie Renner. Samuel Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not qualify for SPD attorney. Minutes filed.
